data.title: Rand Paul – Biography, Wife, Net Worth, Parents and Family Life
data.meta_description: Rand Paul is the son of Ron Paul, the pioneer of the Tea Party movement and one-time US Representative for the 22nd Circuit of Texas. Like his father,
data.text:
He got his first job at John Downing of Downing McPeak Vision Center in Bowling Green where he worked for 5 steady years before looking for better opportunities for Graves Gilbert Clinic and worked 10 years in practice with the clinic which also happened to be was at Bowling Green.

After about 15 years of working for others, RandPaul, who decided to start his own practice in December 2007, where he worked actively until August 5th, 2010. He then declared his interest in running for the Kentucky Senate seat under the auspices of the Republican Party.

An ardent Liberal and Conservative supporter in early 2009, he found favor with his father’s supporters, who found him a worthy candidate to replace or face Republican Sen. Jim Bunning. This opinion was hotly debated in local and national tabloids, where his successes in his father’s political campaigns in the last years since his university days spoke for him.

He received the endorsement of much of the TeasParty and Conservatives running for the same position previously held by Jim Bunning as their representative in the Grand Assembly, after Jim declared that he would not be continuing his third assignment. Rand delivered his acceptance speech on April 15, 2009 in Bowling Green, Kentucky and worked with his supporters to raise funds to support his primary and general election campaigns.

He ran against Republican favorite TreyGrayson in the July 2009 primary, winning it by winning 23% of the party tickets for the general election, where he also ran against top Democratic Shooter Jack Conway emerged victorious by a good 56%. He became the new Senator for Kentucky and was sworn in at the same time as his father, Rand Paul Snr, in January 2011. who served in the House of Representatives.

In December 2015, he was running for re-election as the United States Senator representing Kentucky and running for mayor of Lexington, Jim Gary. He defeated Jim, who polled 42.7% with his 57.3% and was subsequently sworn in.

Senator Rand has served on various Senate committees, including the Energy, Natural Resources, Health, Education, and Labor and Retirement Committees, to name a few.

During his time in the Senate, Rand updated the status of the union address as passed by the Tea Party movement to former US President Barrack Obama, spoken at length in a filibuster for nearly 13 hours; a delaying tactic to prevent the confirmation date from voting on John Brennan, the CIA candidate.

Rand Paul, unlike his other Republican counterpart, has one of the lowest vote counts for non-voting or co-sponsored bills from 2011-2018, at about 3.3%, and he has no record of bills that he primarily authored himself sponsored the convention floor. He is said to have co-funded about 75 bills and serves on a sessional committee on some committees such as the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee, the State Department Committee, and USAID Management, International Operations, and Bilateral International Development. He also advocated privacy reform, amending the balanced budget and limiting political term for incumbents.

assets

Senator Rand Paul has a few other sources of income besides his clinic and serving as a politician. They include; Real Estate, Security/Insurance and Energy. He is the 66th richest Senator with an estimated net worth of approximately $2 million. He has welcomed individual financial donations and contributions to his 2016 presidential contests, which totaled more than $3.4 million.

Family life – parents

Paul was born to Ron Paul; a doctor who specialized as an obstetrician and gynecologist and later a House of Representatives of the United States. Ron tried three times for the presidential mandate, but failed. His wife Carlyn has written and published cookbooks, the proceeds of which she has supported her husband.

The couple is blessed with 5 wonderful children; Ronald aka Ronnie, Paul Jr., Lori Paul Pyeatt, Robert Paul and Joy Paul-LeBlanc. The senator’s siblings are doing well in their respective careers.

who is his wife

Aspiring politician Rand Paul is happy he was married to heartthrob Kelley Ashby and met her in 1988 at Duke University School of Medicine. She was born on September 3, 1963 in Russellville, a writer into a predominantly military family, but grew up in Turkey and other places as her father frequently transmitted.

She was a student at Russellville High School and attended Rhode College, where she earned a degree in English and Communications.

Their union has produced three sons, William (born 1992), Duncan (born 1997) and Robert (born 2000). They are devout Christians and were members of the Baptist but later joined the Presbyterian Church.
